alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Windsor County through 600 PM EDT... At 530 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Windsor, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hartland Four Corners, Windsor, Weathersfield, West Windsor, Ascutney, Hartland, Reading, Ascutney State Park, Brownsville, and Amsden. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 51 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
